snippet: President Obama's campaign put out a video appeal from Anna Wintour, the editor in chief of Vogue magazine, the same day a grim jobs report was released.
abstract: President Obama's campaign put out a video appeal from Anna Wintour, the editor in chief of Vogue magazine, the same day a grim jobs report was released.

headline.main: After a Day of Bad Economic News, an Invitation From Anna Wintour

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items Friday's selection includes a look at Apple putting aside differences with Facebook and how the two sides in the piracy debate are talking pa...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items Friday's selection includes a look at Apple putting aside differences with Facebook and how the two sides in the piracy debate are talking past each other.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Piracy Negotiations and Apple's Smart Move

snippet: The man received an undisclosed amount of cash in the first and third robberies, but left empty-handed in the second.
abstract: Police are searching for a man they say held up three Brooklyn banks in 30 minutes.

headline.main: In Brooklyn, Suspect Robs 3 Banks in 30 Minutes
headline.print_headline: In Brooklyn, Suspect Robs Three Banks In 30 Minutes

snippet: A writer travels all the way to Buenos Aires to taste something heartfelt -- and Korean.
abstract: A writer travels all the way to Buenos Aires to taste something heartfelt -- and Korean.

headline.main: The Case of the Argentine Waiter and the Korean Supper Club

snippet: Buying an individual companyâ€™s stock is a wager on an unknowable future, as Facebook investors will tell you, and it can take decades before you know if you have a winner.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column contends that Facebook's unruly initial public offering, and the subsequent decline in its stock price, underlines how difficult it is for individual investors to profitably pick stocks; argues that in most cases it can take decades of sustained investment in single entities before such bets pay off.

snippet: A May 19 column about telemarketing calls and robocalls elicited responses from several frustrated readers, who say unwanted calls seem to be increasing.
abstract: Alina Tugend Shortcuts column expands on the frustrations of receiving unwanted telemarketing calls; notes that many individuals feel the Do Not Call Registry is less effective than it was when it was created in 2003, and that reporting calls to the Federal Trade Commission is futile.

headline.main: Resilience of Robocalls Leaves a Lot of Ears Ringing
headline.print_headline: Resilience of Robocalls Leaves a Lot of Ears Ringing

snippet: The coming season's trends may be predictable, but these 12 innovative products are anything but.
abstract: The coming season's trends may be predictable, but these 12 innovative products are anything but.

snippet: Friday was a day of grim economic news - a jobs report that put an exclamation point on the financial struggles of average Americans.     But it was also the day that President Obama's campaign chose to put out a video appeal from Anna Wintour, th...
abstract: Caucus column; Obama campaign releases a video appeal from Vogue magazine editor in chief Anna Wintour, who asks supporters to compete with donations for an invitation to a ritzy New York dinner with celebrities and the Obamas, just as a dismal jobs report puts an exclamation point on the financial struggles of average Americans. (M)/

headline.main: Oops Dept.: An Ill-Timed Dinner Offer

snippet: An abridged guide to the many ways that your day is about to get better.
abstract: Abridged guide to 32 inventions and innovations that will affect the daily lives of everyone in the near future. Drawings (L)

headline.main: 32 Innovations That Will Change Your Tomorrow

byline.original: By RICHARD MORGAN, OLIVER STRAND, GRETCHEN REYNOLDS, TIM WU, CLAY RISEN, NATHANIEL PENN, TOM VANDERBILT, PETER SCHWARTZ, ALEX FRENCH, TAMARA WARREN, JAD MOUAWAD, JENNA WORTHAM, JASON FAGONE, CATHERINE RAMPELL, CHRIS WILSON, JONATHAN ZITTRAIN, CORA CURRIER, DAVID POGUE, FARHAD MANJOO, ADDIE MORFOOT, HOWIE KAHN, JACQUELINE BARTON, ELIZABETH WEIL, MICHAEL RUHLMAN and MARGARET ATWOOD
